name: Introduction to Geology
description: This course introduces students to the basic principles of geology, including the structure of the earth and plate tectonics, types of rocks and minerals, and geological time scales.

name: Earth Processes
description: This course explores the physical and chemical processes that shape the Earth, including erosion, weathering, and sedimentation.

name: Introduction to Glaciology
description: This course introduces students to the basic principles of glaciology, including the formation and movement of glaciers, and their role in the Earth system.

name: Geomorphology
description: This course explores landforms and the processes that shape them, including erosion, weathering, and tectonics. Glaciers are also an important focus.

name: Climatology
description: This course is an introduction to the study of climate, including its causes, mechanisms, and variability. This course should be taken alongside or after Introduction to Glaciology.

name: Polar Climate
description: This course studies the climate patterns of Earth's polar regions. This course should be taken after Introduction to Glaciology and Climatology.

name: Ice Dynamics
description: This course explores the mechanics and dynamics of ice, including ice sheets and glaciers. This course should be taken after Introduction to Glaciology and Geomorphology.
